<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/495138763;297449593;h" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="eToro" style="width:100%;max-width: 100px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="100" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby81NC8xNTc2MDc3MTk2LTE1NTcxODAzNDEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>
</th>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>They say business news is boring. Well...this year alone has brought us GameStop mania, a ship stuck in the Suez Canal, the Archegos collapse, a shortage of literally everything, someone named Beeple selling an NFT for $69 million, a European Super League that lasted for 48 hours, and now, perhaps the most absurd of them all, dogecoin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At this point, the Knicks could make a deep run in the playoffs and we wouldn't be surprised. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/09/cyberattack-forces-major-east-coast-pipeline-shut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The I-95 of Fuel Shuts Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Oil pipeline" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDI0L29pbF9waXBlbGluZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Katja Buchholz/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The country’s largest gasoline pipeline is mostly <a href="https://apnews.com/article/europe-hacking-government-and-politics-technology-business-333e47df702f755f8922274389b7e920?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">out of commission</a> after the system’s operator, Colonial Pipeline, got hit with a ransomware attack. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>On Thursday, the hackers reportedly stole nearly 100 gigabytes of data from Colonial’s computer systems, then locked up its computers and demanded payment. Colonial shut down the pipeline Friday as a precaution.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That “</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-09/colonial-hackers-stole-data-thursday-ahead-of-pipeline-shutdown?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">double-extortion</a></span><span>” scheme is a hallmark of the criminal group DarkSide, which experts consider the prime suspect in this hack. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What are the consequences?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well, it’s like if officials shut down I-95 and you had to take Route 1, in all its traffic-light glory, from Florida to Maine.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pipeline is the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/08/us/cyberattack-colonial-pipeline.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">main source</a> of diesel, gasoline, and jet fuel for the East Coast. It hauls more than 100 million gallons of fuel a day from Gulf Coast refineries to major hubs up the coast, including airports in Atlanta, North Carolina, and NYC. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So should we expect a toilet paper-like run on gasoline? </strong>No, but the total damage will depend on how long the outage lasts. If the pipeline is down five-to-six days, it could lead to shortages and price increases. By last night, Colonial had <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/09/pipeline-hack-all-hands-on-deck-to-avert-disruptions-commerce-secretary-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">restored service</a> to some minor parts of its system, but not its four main lines. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This is a pattern...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the past few weeks, while you’ve been focused on the price of dogecoin, various cyber criminals were busy launching ransomware attacks on everything from the Metropolitan Police Department of Washington, DC, to Scripps Health in San Diego. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last year, average cyberattack ransoms paid in the US increased more than 3x to $310,000+, according to the firm Coveware.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>cybersecurity poses a major challenge for the Biden administration. Last week, Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas called ransomware one of his “most <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-09/ransomware-attackers-up-ante-as-white-house-vows-crack-down?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">significant priorities</a> right now,” and the administration has launched an initiative to help critical infrastructure like electric utilities and water districts protect against attacks.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/cheese-ubers-prices-rising-5547?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Time to Binge <em>Extreme Couponing</em>
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>

<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Chapelle money" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/u7c0J0dmV0ZJm/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...or type SAVE20 into every online order, because prices are up across the board, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/consumers-adjust-to-higher-prices-11620552601?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports the WSJ</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Commodities:</strong> Prices of copper, steel, and Catan fan-favorite resource lumber have all <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/05/09/investing/stocks-week-ahead/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soared to record highs</a>, causing a corresponding price increase in end products, like houses. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Groceries: </strong>Corn, soybeans, baked goods, seafood, and even block cheese futures are all up. Of the 52 grocery categories tracked by Nielsen IQ, 50 are <a href="https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2021-05-06/supermarkets-cost-more?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more expensive</a> than they were a year ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Other consumer goods: </strong>Semiconductor chip shortages have led to more expensive cars. Tesla just <a href="https://www.autoweek.com/news/green-cars/a36363666/tesla-raises-model-3-and-model-y-prices-yet-again/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised prices</a> on its Model 3 and Model Y.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Rideshare: </strong>If you thought an Uber/Lyft to Malibu was expensive before the pandemic...last week, executives admitted prices <a href="https://www.axios.com/rideshare-driver-shortage-prices-6921648b-aec5-412d-886d-b6cebd6f9eef.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have perma-surged</a> due to a shortage of drivers. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Should we sound the inflation alarm? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Fed Chair Jerome Powell have argued that the current sticker shock is only temporary. "An episode of one-time price increases as the economy reopens is not the same thing as—and is not likely to lead to—persistently higher year over year inflation into the future,” Powell said.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/10/kentucky-derbys-winning-colt-failed-drug-test?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Kentucky Derby’s Drug Problem
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="LOUISVILLE, KY - MAY 01:  Medina Spirit (8) ridden by John Velasquez lea..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDI4L2hvcnNlX3JhY2luZ19tYXlfMDFfa2VudC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Icon Sportswire/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This news might give your next mint julep a bitter aftertaste: Medina Spirit, the winning horse of last week’s Kentucky Derby, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/09/sports/horse-racing/bob-baffert-kentucky-derby-medina-spirit-drug-test.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">failed a drug test</a> administered after the race. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If a second sample confirms the initial result, the colt will be disqualified and cede his championship to runner-up Mandaloun, becoming the third horse in the Derby’s history to lose a title. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While any gamblers who bet on Medina Spirit will keep their winnings, owner Amr Zedan would hand over his $1.8 million prize to Mandaloun’s owner.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Medina Spirit’s trainer, Bob Baffert, who’s a BFD in the land of big hats, has had 30 failed drug tests for his horses over the four decades of his career...and five in about the last year. But Baffert <a href="https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/sports/horse-racing-kentucky-derby-winner-medina-spirit-fails-drugs-test-2021-05-09/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">seems baffled</a>: “There are problems in racing, but it's not Bob Baffert. I don't believe in conspiracy theories, but why is it happening to me?"</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Baffert is right—there are doping problems in horse racing. The industry will try to address the issue with the Horseracing Integrity and Safety Act, which will go into effect in July of next year. The bill will lean on the Federal Trade Commission and the United States Anti-Doping Agency to write and enforce penalties for using off-limits drugs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SNL</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Yeah, it’s a hustle.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How Elon Musk, appearing as financial expert “Lloyd Ostertag” on <em>SNL</em>, described dogecoin. The meme-based crypto <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/dogecoin-plunges-nearly-30-percent-during-elon-musk-s-snl-n1266774?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declined nearly 30%</a> during Musk’s appearance, which was livestreamed to more than 100 countries. But later in the weekend, Musk’s SpaceX said it will launch a “DOGE-1 Mission to the moon” <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/09/spacex-accepts-dogecoin-payment-for-doge-1-mission-to-the-moon.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">funded completely</a> by dogecoin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Just 4% of iPhone users have <a href="https://www.macrumors.com/2021/05/07/most-iphone-users-app-tracking-opt-out/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opted in</a> to app tracking after updating their phones to Apple’s new iOS 14.5, which introduced new privacy features. That is exactly what companies like Facebook were worried about. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Online cheating charges upend Dartmouth medical school. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/09/technology/dartmouth-geisel-medical-cheating.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/09/week-ahead-may-10?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Easing Covid restrictions: </strong>Today, the New York Stock Exchange is <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/nyse-to-loosen-covid-restrictions-starting-may-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inviting</a> more traders and journalists back to its iconic floor, Facebook is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-facebook/facebook-plans-to-reopen-california-hq-on-may-10-idUSKBN2BI2QG?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reopening</a> its California HQ to 10% capacity, and large Massachusetts venues like the TD Garden can <a href="https://apnews.com/article/ma-state-wire-travel-lifestyle-coronavirus-pandemic-business-afd22d684187002c75b2596c62bf7c58?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">double</a> their capacity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data: </strong>Remember all those price hikes from earlier in the newsletter? We’ll get an even clearer picture of <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/07/inflation-is-the-big-challenge-for-markets-and-the-fed-in-the-week-ahead.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">inflation</a> when the government releases the consumer price index (CPI) on Wednesday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Stow your electronics and lift your tray tables, because we’re in the final descent of Q1 earnings season. This week’s highlights include Marriott, Electronic Arts, Palantir, Coinbase, Bumble, SoftBank, Disney, Airbnb, and Alibaba.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Preakness is on Saturday...but will Medina Spirit be there? </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eid al-Fitr begins at sundown on Wednesday, marking the end of the holy month of Ramadan.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tomorrow is “Eat What You Want Day,” apparently.</span></li>
</ul>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you a few of our favorite, business-related reads. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2013, Brad Stone wrote the definitive book on Amazon, but that was before Alexa, Whole Foods, HQ2, and stratospheric growth during the pandemic. Now, Stone is back with </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781982132613?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Amazon Unbound</em></a></span><span>, a deep dive into Amazon’s latest successes and growing pains under the leadership of Jeff Bezos.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>From dream jobs to building relationships, Rainesford Stauffer’s </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780062998989?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>An Ordinary Age</em></a></span><span><span> strolls down the narrow path to success of young adulthood and explains why everything feels so frickin’ hard in your 20s.</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePolitics: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAll the chatter in DC is around the future of GOP representative and Trump critic Liz Cheney, who appears to be width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MDI0L29pbF9waXBlbGluZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKatja Buchholz/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe country’s largest gasoline pipeline is mostly \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/europe-hacking-government-and-politics-technology-business-333e47df702f755f8922274389b7e920?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eout of commission\u003c/a\u003e after the system’s operator, Colonial Pipeline, got hit with a ransomware attack. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eOn Thursday, the hackers reportedly stole nearly 100 gigabytes of data from Colonial’s computer systems, then locked up its computers and demanded payment. Colonial shut down the pipeline Friday as a precaution.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-09/colonial-hackers-stole-data-thursday-ahead-of-pipeline-shutdown?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edouble-extortion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” scheme is a hallmark of the criminal group DarkSide, which experts consider the prime suspect in this hack. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat are the consequences?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWell, it’s like if officials shut down I-95 and you had to take Route 1, in all its traffic-light glory, from Florida to Maine.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pipeline is the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/08/us/cyberattack-colonial-pipeline.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emain source\u003c/a\u003e of diesel, gasoline, and jet fuel for the East Coast. It hauls more than 100 million gallons of fuel a day from Gulf Coast refineries to major hubs up the coast, including airports in Atlanta, North Carolina, and NYC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo should we expect a toilet paper-like run on gasoline? \u003c/strong\u003eNo, but the total damage will depend on how long the outage lasts. If the pipeline is down five-to-six days, it could lead to shortages and price increases. By last night, Colonial had \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/09/pipeline-hack-all-hands-on-deck-to-avert-disruptions-commerce-secretary-says.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erestored service\u003c/a\u003e to some minor parts of its system, but not its four main lines. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis is a pattern...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the past few weeks, while you’ve been focused on the price of dogecoin, various cyber criminals were busy launching ransomware attacks on everything from the Metropolitan Police Department of Washington, DC, to Scripps Health in San Diego. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast year, average cyberattack ransoms paid in the US increased more than 3x to $310,000+, according to the firm Coveware.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ecybersecurity poses a major challenge for the Biden administration. Last week, Department of Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas called ransomware one of his “most \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-09/ransomware-attackers-up-ante-as-white-house-vows-crack-down?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esignificant priorities\u003c/a\u003e right now,” and the administration has launched an initiative to help critical infrastructure like electric utilities and water districts protect against attacks.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis news might give your next mint julep a bitter aftertaste: Medina Spirit, the winning horse of last week’s Kentucky Derby, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/09/sports/horse-racing/bob-baffert-kentucky-derby-medina-spirit-drug-test.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efailed a drug test\u003c/a\u003e administered after the race. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf a second sample confirms the initial result, the colt will be disqualified and cede his championship to runner-up Mandaloun, becoming the third horse in the Derby’s history to lose a title. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile any gamblers who bet on Medina Spirit will keep their winnings, owner Amr Zedan would hand over his $1.8 million prize to Mandaloun’s owner.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMedina Spirit’s trainer, Bob Baffert, who’s a BFD in the land of big hats, has had 30 failed drug tests for his horses over the four decades of his career...and five in about the last year. But Baffert \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/sports/horse-racing-kentucky-derby-winner-medina-spirit-fails-drugs-test-2021-05-09/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseems baffled\u003c/a\u003e: “There are problems in racing, but it's not Bob Baffert. I don't believe in conspiracy theories, but why is it happening to me?\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBaffert is right—there are doping problems in horse racing. The industry will try to address the issue with the Horseracing Integrity and Safety Act, which will go into effect in July of next year. The bill will lean on the Federal Trade Commission and the United States Anti-Doping Agency to write and enforce penalties for using off-limits drugs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp
